channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Liter & firework debris all along gilbert road, 22nd October
item.description:
Resident reporting since the last log on FMS on the 13th Under Ref 8290439 The report was closed however the4 same litter and extra Debris now from the fireworks is all along the road including the litter bin which is overflowing this is outside the newsagent and the rubbish is all over the floor. Please could someone look into this again
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Gilbert Road, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Raised British telecom inspection cover, 22nd October
item.description:
BT inspection cover is raised by well over a inch

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen apples, leaves and litter, 22nd October
item.description:
A lot of fallen apples from the tree outside the residential care home, making the street slippery, especially when wet. There are also a lot of fallen leaves along the whole street. Litter is also quite problematic, but especially after bin collection when there is a lot of rubbish / recycling dropped in the street and left in the street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ansdell Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog Waste at various points along Ansdell Road & Dundas Road, 22nd October
item.description:
Dog & other animal Waste: at the junction of Dundas / Ansdell Road and at various points along Ansdell Road. It is continually a problem and particularly bad on the pavement alongside the residents home. At various points along the street there is waste constantly appearing. Ideally the whole street would be walked and cleaned for waste. Children live on this street and many walk this street to reach Hollydale School so it often gets trodden in and made worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ansdell Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tower St, 22nd October
item.description:
Vehicles have been seen making illegal right turns here especially at night from Tower Street onto Monmouth Street by driving across the pavement (corner), avoiding bollards. Request bell bollard or similar to be installed here please to prevent it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Street, Bloomsbury, London

item.title: Outside Hall Junior School Belsize Park NW3 4EH, 22nd October
item.description:
Stop signs advising one way street were removed during roadworks and haven't been replaced since works completed. A vehicle has backed into one of the sign poles at Entrance to Belsize Park and it's now leaning at a dangerous angle.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 68, Belsize Park, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bins full and cluttering pavement, 22nd October
item.description:
Outside 51 Lordship Park N16 there are many black bins full and always left on the pavement which makes it harder for people (especially those in wheelchairs or using mobility scooters) to use the pavement. Please can you remove the bins asap. Thanks

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lordship Park, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping, 22nd October
item.description:
Furniture, clothing bags and several other items been dumped o/s 3 Central Avenue. Resident has reported this to the police and was advised to contact the council. Cad Ref: 01/8089293/25
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Avenue, East Wickham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety strips removed, 22nd October
item.description:
Rubber safety strips were removed from their grooves on the steps. The strips have been removed from site but never replaced. This has created a safety problem. This was reported a year ago and the case has been closed without a resolution. On many occasions when descending my foot can get caught in the groove and cause me to stumble; luckily I haven’t fallen over— yet!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartslock Drive, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Donkey Alley, East Dulwich, London

item.title: Dumped rubbish, reported before, not cleared, 22nd October
item.description:
Someone has left a green bin at the end of Sister Mabels Way alleyway path (leading out to Peckham Hill street) it does not belong to any of the households on the street. It’s overflowing with waste strewn all over the path and pavement. Please can the team attend? This is the second time I’m reporting this.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sister Mabel's Way, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet
